availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Franklin Tincher (Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and corp 1st Reg Capital Guards)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Angeline Tincher. Father of Ambrose Tincher and Elizabeth Tincher. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a private during the U.S.-Mexico War. Farmhand in Bath County in 1860. Served in Captain Bussey's Bath County Rangers Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from December 1863 to July 15, 1864. Reported as deserted in Frankfort, Kentucky, on July 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 200.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Mudlick, p. 22B.
Indexes to the Carded Records of Soldiers Who Served in Volunteer Organizations During the Mexican War, compiled 1899 - 1927, documenting the period 1846 - 1848, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M616, Roll 0037.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 761.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application 375125, Application #375125.
KYR-0001-004-0383.
